did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: David Lee Guss photographs, 1967-1982
did.abstract: Photographs, 8x10, taken chiefly in Arizona from 1967 to 1982.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

The user agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the Arizona Board of Regents for the University of Arizona, its officers, employees, and agents from and against all claims made by any person asserting that he or she is an owner of copyright.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: David Lee Guss photographs(AZ 505). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: David Lee Guss is a free-lance photographer from Tucson, Arizona. A number of his photographs appeared in the motion picture The Border.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into two series:

list.item: Series II: Biographical Materials, Articles and Miscellaneous Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Photographs, 8x10, taken chiefly in Arizona from 1967 to 1982. Subjects include Tucson buildings, parades, and people; motion pictures filmed in Arizona; Native Americans in Arizona, including Apache, Yaqui, and Tohono O'Odham; scenes and people in U.S.-Mexico border towns, Tombstone, Ariz., and ghost towns in Arizona and New Mexico.

item.subject: Indians of North America -- Arizona -- Photographs
Cities and towns -- Mexican-American Border Region -- Photographs
